item.title: Jamaat, seven other parties hold meeting with CEC
item.description: Delegations from eight political parties who came to the Election Commission (EC) to submit a memorandum demanding a referendum in November have met Chief Election Commissioner AMM Nasir Uddin. EC Secretary Akhtar Ahmed was also present at the meeting, which began at 1pm on Thursday, reports bdn

item.title: Factors affecting growth of industrial credit
item.description: The modest surge in the disbursement of industrial credit in the last fiscal year may be considered as a sign of a rebound in the industrial activities in the country, as well as overall economic growth. Although many other economic indicators are already available, the central bank released the an

item.title: Child kidnapped using 'devil breath' in Dhaka rescued, 3 held
item.description: Members of Rapid Action Battalion (RAB)-4 rescued a four-year-old girl, who was abducted using ‘devil breath’, from Pallabi area of Dhaka and arrested three people from Keraniganj of Dhaka on Wednesday. The arrestees were Swapan Sardar, 41, Beauty Begum, 40 and Nargis Begum, 30, UNB re

item.title: Hold polls by February to save country from ‘civil war-like situation’: Patwary
item.description: National Citizen Party (NCP) chief coordinator Nasiruddin Patwary on Thursday urged the government to hold elections by February to save the country from a ‘civil war-like situation’. “The country is heading toward a different kind of situation. Announce elections by February. If

item.title: EC to sit for first inter-ministry meeting ahead of election
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) will exchange views with the senior officials of ministries, departments, directorates, agencies and authorities with connections to preparations for the 13th national parliamentary election. Chief Election Commissioner AMM Nasir Uddin will preside over the meeting at

item.title: 4 SPs promoted to DIG
item.description: Four Superintendents of Police (SPs) have been promoted to Deputy Inspector General (DIG). The Public Security Division under the Home Ministry issued a notification in this regard on Thursday, UNB reports. They are-Md. Shahrier, superintendent of Anti-Terrorism unit, Mohammad Abdul K

item.title: Education cadre lecturers warn of 'work stoppage' for promotions
item.description: “Promotion-deprived” lecturers of the Bangladesh Civil Service (BCS) General Education Cadre have demanded that those eligible be promoted by Nov 12. They warned of a work stoppage if their demand is not met. The lecturers staged a sit-in demonstration at the Shikkha Bhaban premises s
